Hero.text: {=D3463d2f}Maeda Toshiie (前田利家) is from Owari Province, born as Inuchiyo (犬千代), and identified himself as Maeda Matazaemon (前田又左衛門) later. He began to serve Oda Nobunaga as a page boy, and later as his elite soldier. He likes to use a long pike with a crimson shaft. So, he is nicknamed Yari no Mataza, or Mataza the spear, due to his skill and this showy weapon. He is sometimes quite short-tempered. He had been exiled for a few years and was allowed to rejoin Oda's army just a few years ago. He committed a crime to kill a favored servant of Nobunaga who insulted Toshiie.

{=540e3dFA}Akechi Mitsuhide (明智光秀), born as Hikotarou (彦太郎), identified himself as Akechi Jūbē (明智十兵衛) later. He and his family don't serve the Oda clan hereditarily. After over a decade wandering, he began to serve Oda Nobunaga. Now, Nobunaga favors his talent and frankly calls him Kinka Aatama, the Kumquat Head, which means that he teased his bald head.

{=4FEF32B1}Tokugawa Ieyasu (徳川家康) was born as Takechiyo (竹千代), and once identified himself as Matsudaira Jirou-saburou (松平次郎三郎), as a young head of the Matsudaira clan, the current Tokugawa clan. He is young, but rumored that he is thoughtful and patient. He is also known by several names: Motonobu (元信), Motoyasu (元康), and Ieyasu (家康). In this period, a samurai lord gives one kanji character from his name to his retainer to rename his name. This is often an honor, but also a proof of servitude. After the death of Imagawa Yoshimoto (今川義元), Ieyasu, whose name was Motoyasu at that time, immediately renamed himself Ieyasu.

{=88741768}Honda Tadakatsu (本多忠勝), born as Nabenosuke (鍋之助), identified himself as Honda Heihachirou (本多平八郎), is one of the powerful warlords serving Ieyasu. His spear is said to be so sharpened that a dragonfly landing on the top is bisected by its weight. He is very strong, so it is rumored that he has never been wounded on the battlefield.

{=8c994Bb0}Hattori Masanari (服部正成), identified as himself Hattori Hanzou (服部半蔵), was born in Iga province. He is a samurai serving the Tokugawa clan. He is a master of the spear and is famous for his performance on the battlefield, so he is feared like an Oni demon.

{=Bd0b0fd8}Nagao Terutora (長尾輝虎) was born as the illegitimate child of Nagao Tamekage and was named Torachiyo (虎千代). Although the polygamy system was accepted among the Samurai society at that period, children were discriminated against, whether their mother was the first spouse. He lived in the Rinsen-ji temple in his childhood. Later, he was summoned to the Nagao family and finally inherited the head of the clan from his sickly older half-brother. His name became Kagetora (景虎) and his byname became Nagao Heizou (長尾平三) when coming of age. But he renamed himself Terutora later. He is very faithful due to, or not to, his childhood life, and particularly devoted to Bishamonten, a Buddhist guardian and a deity of war. Later, he became a monk with the Buddhist name Hushikian Kenshin (不識庵謙信), named after a monk who raised him. After people recognized his martial talent, he was also admired as Gunshin, the God of War. His current surname, Uesugi, was inherited from Uesugi Norimasa, a former Kantou Kanrei, the regent of the Vice Shogun.

{=d04Ca636}Takeda Harunobu (武田晴信), born as Katsuchiyo (勝千代), identified himself as Takeda Tarou (武田太郎), is a cunning, old strategist, diplomat, and warlord. His name, Harunobu, derives from Yoshiharu, an ex-Shogun of Ashikaga dynasty. He has ruled Kai province, a mountainous and hard land, for many years, and is known for his strategic and martial talent and several times of battles against Uesugi Kenshin. Through the battles, he became a monk with the Buddhist name Tokueiken Shingen (徳榮軒信玄), his most well-known name later. He also preferred high-society culture and invited famous Buddhist monks, the most intellectual people during this period, many times. His banner shows a famous phrase, Fūrinkazan, cited from Sonshi, the Art of War by Sun Tzu, which they may have taught him.{NEWLINE}{NEWLINE}It is said that Shingen invented Houtou, a kind of noodle dish. It contains some root vegetables and doesn't contain meat. However, it is well-nourished. This is just a lore, but this lore it self shows his reputation among folks.
